title: Question 4
prompt:
In the passage, Nora and Torvald disagree about borrowing money. Nora believes that borrowing money can be a valuable convenience. Torvald’s attitude is significantly different. Which statement best describes how Torvald’s attitude contrasts with Nora’s?

Torvald believes that
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: When Torvald reminds Nora of how long it will be before they get the money from his new salary, she immediately says that they can just borrow money until then. She sees borrowing as a convenience during the next few months: “Pooh! we can borrow until then.” Meanwhile, Torvald sees borrowing as a risk, no matter how certain future money is. He hypothesizes that he could die and not be able to pay the money back: “Suppose, now, that I borrowed fifty pounds today … and then on New Year’s Eve a slate fell on my head and killed me…” Torvald also sees borrowing as shameful, calling a life without debt the “straight road.” He doesn’t think that a good life can be built on borrowing: “There can be no freedom or beauty about a home life that depends on borrowing and debt. We two have kept bravely on the straight road so far…”
